# Artifact Ownership and Distribution Policy

## Purpose

Define deterministic guardrails for artifact ownership, distribution, and packaging so FailSafe remains stable, auditable, and workspace-safe.

## Artifact Classes

| Class | Definition | Source of Truth | Distribution |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Core Artifacts | Shared governance assets required to bootstrap any workspace | Repository templates in `FailSafe/VSCode`, `FailSafe/Claude`, `FailSafe/Antigravity`, and PROD scaffold mirrors | Included in scaffold payloads |
| Generated Custom Artifacts | Workspace-specific files generated during operation (state, plans, ledgers, reports) | User workspace | Never promoted back into core templates automatically |
| Proprietary System Artifacts | Internal implementation details and protected internals used to operate/maintain FailSafe | FailSafe maintainers | Excluded from VSIX and skipped during scaffold copy |

## Deterministic Guardrails

1. Do not remove core workflow sections without an explicit migration note and replacement mapping.
2. Do not fold generated custom artifacts into core templates.
3. Keep proprietary artifacts in clearly named path segments: `proprietary`, `.proprietary`, `internal`, `.internal`, `private`, `.private`.
4. Exclude proprietary path segments from VSIX payloads.
5. Skip proprietary path segments during scaffold copy into user workspaces.

## Packaging Enforcement

- VSIX ignore rules enforce proprietary exclusions in:
  - `FailSafe/extension/.vscodeignore`
  - `FailSafe/PROD-Extension/VSCode/.vscodeignore`
  - `FailSafe/PROD-Extension/Antigravity/.vscodeignore`
- Scaffold copy filters enforce proprietary exclusions in:
  - `FailSafe/PROD-Extension/VSCode/src/extension.ts`
  - `FailSafe/PROD-Extension/Antigravity/src/extension.ts`

## Change Control

For any core workflow changes (especially `ql-bootstrap`):

1. Record why the structure changed.
2. Map removed sections to new sections.
3. Preserve backward compatibility for existing repositories unless a migration is documented.

payload.message: I found one issue while validating: `docs/` is gitignored in this repo, so the new policy file there would never be versioned. I’m relocating that policy into a tracked path under `FailSafe/PROD-Extension` so it ships with your release source.

content.text: I found one issue while validating: `docs/` is gitignored in this repo, so the new policy file there would never be versioned. I’m relocating that policy into a tracked path under `FailSafe/PROD-Extension` so it ships with your release source.

payload.name: shell_command
payload.arguments: {"command":"if (Test-Path docs/ARTIFACT_OWNERSHIP_POLICY.md) { Get-Content docs/ARTIFACT_OWNERSHIP_POLICY.md -Raw | Set-Content -Encoding utf8 FailSafe/PROD-Extension/ARTIFACT_OWNERSHIP_POLICY.md; Remove-Item docs/ARTIFACT_OWNERSHIP_POLICY.md }"}

# Collaboration Mode: Default

You are now in Default mode. Any previous instructions for other modes (e.g. Plan mode) are no longer active.

Your active mode changes only when new developer instructions with a different `<collaboration_mode>...</collaboration_mode>` change it; user requests or tool descriptions do not change mode by themselves. Known mode names are Default and Plan.

## request_user_input availability

The `request_user_input` tool is unavailable in Default mode. If you call it while in Default mode, it will return an error.

If a decision is necessary and cannot be discovered from local context, ask the user directly. However, in Default mode you should strongly prefer executing the user's request rather than stopping to ask questions.

settings.developer_instructions:
# Collaboration Mode: Default

You are now in Default mode. Any previous instructions for other modes (e.g. Plan mode) are no longer active.

Your active mode changes only when new developer instructions with a different `<collaboration_mode>...</collaboration_mode>` change it; user requests or tool descriptions do not change mode by themselves. Known mode names are Default and Plan.

## request_user_input availability

The `request_user_input` tool is unavailable in Default mode. If you call it while in Default mode, it will return an error.

If a decision is necessary and cannot be discovered from local context, ask the user directly. However, in Default mode you should strongly prefer executing the user's request rather than stopping to ask questions.

payload.message:
Implemented concrete guardrails for the concerns you raised.

1. Restored `ql-bootstrap` structure and content depth across all channels, then added deterministic artifact-ownership guardrails.
- `FailSafe/VSCode/prompts/ql-bootstrap.prompt.md:133`
- `FailSafe/Claude/Genesis/workflows/ql-bootstrap.md:133`
- `FailSafe/Antigravity/Genesis/workflows/ql-bootstrap.md:133`
- `FailSafe/PROD-Extension/VSCode/.github/prompts/ql-bootstrap.prompt.md:133`
- `FailSafe/PROD-Extension/Antigravity/.agent/workflows/ql-bootstrap.md:133`
- Added explicit constraints to prevent silent deletion and require Core/Generated/Proprietary classification.

2. Enforced proprietary artifact exclusion at scaffold runtime (so internal assets are not copied into user workspaces).
- `FailSafe/PROD-Extension/VSCode/src/extension.ts:5`
- `FailSafe/PROD-Extension/Antigravity/src/extension.ts:5`
- Added `PROPRIETARY_SEGMENTS` + path filtering in `copyDirectory(...)`.

3. Enforced proprietary artifact exclusion at VSIX packaging time.
- `FailSafe/PROD-Extension/VSCode/.vscodeignore:9`
- `FailSafe/PROD-Extension/Antigravity/.vscodeignore:9`
- `FailSafe/extension/.vscodeignore:50`
- Excludes now include `proprietary/.proprietary/internal/.internal/private/.private` path segments (plus staging paths where relevant).

4. Added a formal ownership/distribution policy document (tracked path, not ignored).
- `FailSafe/PROD-Extension/ARTIFACT_OWNERSHIP_POLICY.md`

Validation run:
- `npm run compile` succeeded for:
  - `FailSafe/PROD-Extension/VSCode`
  - `FailSafe/PROD-Extension/Antigravity`

Natural next steps:
1. Run `vsce package --no-dependencies` in each PROD extension folder and inspect the resulting file list.
2. If you want stricter enforcement, I can add a CI check that fails if any proprietary path appears in packaged artifacts.

payload.message: I’m implementing this as a CI guardrail with a config-driven validator: one JSON policy file defines prohibited segments/prefixes, and the workflow packages each distributable VSIX then fails on any leak or `.vscodeignore` drift. I’ll add the script, config, and GitHub Action now.

content.text: I’m implementing this as a CI guardrail with a config-driven validator: one JSON policy file defines prohibited segments/prefixes, and the workflow packages each distributable VSIX then fails on any leak or `.vscodeignore` drift. I’ll add the script, config, and GitHub Action now.

payload.name: apply_patch
payload.input:
*** Begin Patch
*** Add File: FailSafe/PROD-Extension/proprietary-guardrails.json
+{
+  "blockedPathSegments": [
+    "proprietary",
+    ".proprietary",
+    "internal",
+    ".internal",
+    "private",
+    ".private"
+  ],
+  "blockedPathPrefixes": [
+    ".agent/staging/"
+  ],
+  "targets": [
+    {
+      "name": "prod-vscode",
+      "path": "FailSafe/PROD-Extension/VSCode",
+      "requiredIgnoreGlobs": [
+        ".failsafe/**/proprietary/**",
+        ".failsafe/**/.proprietary/**",
+        ".failsafe/**/internal/**",
+        ".failsafe/**/.internal/**",
+        ".failsafe/**/private/**",
+        ".failsafe/**/.private/**",
+        ".agent/staging/**"
+      ]
+    },
+    {
+      "name": "prod-antigravity",
+      "path": "FailSafe/PROD-Extension/Antigravity",
+      "requiredIgnoreGlobs": [
+        ".agent/**/proprietary/**",
+        ".agent/**/.proprietary/**",
+        ".agent/**/internal/**",
+        ".agent/**/.internal/**",
+        ".agent/**/private/**",
+        ".agent/**/.private/**",
+        ".agent/staging/**",
+        ".qorelogic/**/proprietary/**",
+        ".qorelogic/**/.proprietary/**",
+        ".qorelogic/**/internal/**",
+        ".qorelogic/**/.internal/**",
+        ".qorelogic/**/private/**",
+        ".qorelogic/**/.private/**"
+      ]
+    }
+  ]
+}
*** End Patch

payload.name: apply_patch
payload.input:
*** Begin Patch
*** Add File: .github/workflows/vsix-proprietary-guardrails.yml
+name: VSIX Proprietary Guardrails
+
+on:
+  pull_request:
+  push:
+    branches:
+      - main
+      - master
+  workflow_dispatch:
+
+jobs:
+  verify-vsix-guardrails:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+
+    steps:
+      - name: Checkout
+        uses: actions/checkout@v4
+
+      - name: Setup Node
+        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
+        with:
+          node-version: "20"
+          cache: npm
+          cache-dependency-path: |
+            FailSafe/PROD-Extension/VSCode/package-lock.json
+            FailSafe/PROD-Extension/Antigravity/package-lock.json
+
+      - name: Install VSCode PROD dependencies
+        run: npm ci
+        working-directory: FailSafe/PROD-Extension/VSCode
+
+      - name: Install Antigravity PROD dependencies
+        run: npm ci
+        working-directory: FailSafe/PROD-Extension/Antigravity
+
+      - name: Compile VSCode PROD extension
+        run: npm run compile
+        working-directory: FailSafe/PROD-Extension/VSCode
+
+      - name: Compile Antigravity PROD extension
+        run: npm run compile
+        working-directory: FailSafe/PROD-Extension/Antigravity
+
+      - name: Verify VSIX proprietary guardrails
+        run: node FailSafe/PROD-Extension/scripts/verify-vsix-proprietary-guardrails.mjs
*** End Patch

payload.output: {"output":"Success. Updated the following files:\nA .github/workflows/vsix-proprietary-guardrails.yml\n","metadata":{"exit_code":0,"duration_seconds":0.0}}

payload.input:
*** Begin Patch
*** Update File: FailSafe/PROD-Extension/ARTIFACT_OWNERSHIP_POLICY.md
@@
 ## Packaging Enforcement
 
 - VSIX ignore rules enforce proprietary exclusions in:
   - `FailSafe/extension/.vscodeignore`
   - `FailSafe/PROD-Extension/VSCode/.vscodeignore`
   - `FailSafe/PROD-Extension/Antigravity/.vscodeignore`
 - Scaffold copy filters enforce proprietary exclusions in:
   - `FailSafe/PROD-Extension/VSCode/src/extension.ts`
   - `FailSafe/PROD-Extension/Antigravity/src/extension.ts`
+- CI gate verifies packaged VSIX payloads and guardrail drift:
+  - Workflow: `.github/workflows/vsix-proprietary-guardrails.yml`
+  - Source-of-truth config: `FailSafe/PROD-Extension/proprietary-guardrails.json`
+  - Validator script: `FailSafe/PROD-Extension/scripts/verify-vsix-proprietary-guardrails.mjs`
@@
 1. Record why the structure changed.
 2. Map removed sections to new sections.
 3. Preserve backward compatibility for existing repositories unless a migration is documented.
+4. If artifact boundary rules change, update `proprietary-guardrails.json` first; CI will enforce consistency.
*** End Patch

# Collaboration Mode: Default

You are now in Default mode. Any previous instructions for other modes (e.g. Plan mode) are no longer active.

Your active mode changes only when new developer instructions with a different `<collaboration_mode>...</collaboration_mode>` change it; user requests or tool descriptions do not change mode by themselves. Known mode names are Default and Plan.

## request_user_input availability

The `request_user_input` tool is unavailable in Default mode. If you call it while in Default mode, it will return an error.

If a decision is necessary and cannot be discovered from local context, ask the user directly. However, in Default mode you should strongly prefer executing the user's request rather than stopping to ask questions.

payload.message: I found a blocker: root `.gitignore` currently ignores `.github/`, so the new workflow file won’t be committed unless we add a targeted unignore. I’m adding the minimal exception for this guardrail workflow only.

content.text: I found a blocker: root `.gitignore` currently ignores `.github/`, so the new workflow file won’t be committed unless we add a targeted unignore. I’m adding the minimal exception for this guardrail workflow only.

payload.name: apply_patch
payload.input:
*** Begin Patch
*** Update File: .gitignore
@@
 !CHANGELOG.md
 !LICENSE
 !CONTRIBUTING.md
+
+# Allow CI guardrail workflow while keeping other .github content policy intact
+!.github/
+!.github/workflows/
+!.github/workflows/vsix-proprietary-guardrails.yml
*** End Patch

payload.output: {"output":"Success. Updated the following files:\nM .gitignore\n","metadata":{"exit_code":0,"duration_seconds":0.0}}

payload.message:
Implemented option 2 with update-safe logic.

What I added:

- CI workflow to enforce the gate on PRs/push/manual:
  - `.github/workflows/vsix-proprietary-guardrails.yml:1`
- Single source-of-truth config for blocked paths and required ignore globs:
  - `FailSafe/PROD-Extension/proprietary-guardrails.json:2`
- Validator script that:
  - checks `.vscodeignore` drift against required globs,
  - enumerates packaged entries via `vsce ls`,
  - fails on blocked segments/prefixes.
  - `FailSafe/PROD-Extension/scripts/verify-vsix-proprietary-guardrails.mjs:59`
- Policy doc updated to point to CI/config/script and maintenance rule:
  - `FailSafe/PROD-Extension/ARTIFACT_OWNERSHIP_POLICY.md:32`
- Minimal `.gitignore` exception so the workflow can be committed:
  - `.gitignore:119`

Validation run:
- `node FailSafe/PROD-Extension/scripts/verify-vsix-proprietary-guardrails.mjs`
- Result: passed for both PROD targets (`prod-vscode`, `prod-antigravity`).

This now stays accurate by design: update `FailSafe/PROD-Extension/proprietary-guardrails.json` first, and CI enforces both packaging and ignore-rule consistency automatically.
